Description: The success factors for drug discovery and development campaigns in oncology are— through decades of experience— a sound data-based disease hypothesis, the generation of the best suitable asset and its in-depth characterization. Key elements to achieve this include sufficient target validation, decisive target-tailored in vitro and in vivo assays, in-depth translational exploration, mode of action elucidation and understanding of PK-PD relationship. In this presentation we will show real-life project examples how we scientifically helped to identify the best compounds, to compensate liabilities, to generate biomarker strategies and to diversify and expand potential patient populations.
